citeinfo.title: Brood Parasitism on Neotropical Migrants

descript.abstract: See individual brood parasitism data sets listed in Cross Reference.
descript.purpose: To assess the effect of brood parasitism on neotropical migrants.
descript.supplinf:
Information for this metadata was adapted from the U.S. Geological Survey, Biological Resources Division, Patuxent Wildlife Research Center Showcase site at http://www.pwrc.usgs.gov/resshow/hahn1rs/hahn1rs.h tm. Internal Filename - usgsbrdpwrc0013. A digital copy of this metadata file is available in text, html, and sgml format on the National Biological Information Infrastructure NBII) Metadata Clearinghouse.
The previous online linkage was determined to be broken in October 2010 and moved here. The previous online linkage was:
http://www.pwrc.usgs.gov/resshow/hahn1rs/hahn1rs.h tm

spdom.descgeog: Varies depending upon the specific brood parasitism data set. Some data sets from New York

distinfo.distliab: Although these data have been processed successfully on a computer system at the U.S. Geological Survey, no warranty expressed or implied is made regarding the accuracy or utility of the data on any other system or for general or scientific purposes, nor shall the act of distribution constitute any such warranty. This disclaimer applies both to individual use of the data and aggregate use with other data. It is strongly recommended that these data are directly acquired from a U.S. Geological Survey server, and not indirectly through other sources which may have changed the data in some way. It is also strongly recommended that careful attention be paid to the contents of the metadata file associated with these data. The U.S. Geological Survey shall not be held liable for improper or incorrect use of the data described and/or contained herein.
